laboratory_examinations.findings: Specific immunoglobulin M antibodies detected, enzyme-linked immunoassay: 4.0 U/ml; Western immunoblot: 60 kDa, 41 kDa, 22 kDa; no immunoglobulin G antibodies.
Moderate proliferation of the patientâ€™s mononuclear cells against B. burgdorferi antigens, 15,000 cpm; maximum: 22,500 cpm.
Visual acuity increased to 20/25 by day 3 after corticosteroid treatment, no detectable scleritis at final examination 6 months later.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual acuity improved from 20/60 to 20/25 by day 3 and became normal at 6-month follow-up, with no detectable scleritis.
